skill.name: conventions
skill.description: Load coding conventions and style guidelines when writing or reviewing code. Ensures consistency with project standards.
skill.summary: Load coding conventions and style guidelines when writing or reviewing code. Ensures consistency wit...
skill.author: Clouder0

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based knowledge skill with no executable code. It only defines metadata for loading coding conventions from conventions.json. The static scanner produced false positives by misidentifying metadata fields (URLs, hashes, skill name) as security threats. No network access, no file system operations beyond reading convention files, and no external commands.

content.value_statement: Teams need consistent coding standards to maintain code quality across projects. This skill loads project conventions to ensure code follows established patterns during writing and review.
actual_capabilities: Loads project coding conventions from conventions.json
Provides naming convention guidelines for code elements
Supplies file organization and structure standards
Defines error handling and logging patterns
limitations: Does not enforce conventions automatically on code
Requires manual activation by the user

use_cases.title: Write Standards-Compliant Code
use_cases.description: Write new code that follows project conventions and team standards

use_cases.title: Review Code Compliance
use_cases.description: Review pull requests for convention compliance and style adherence

use_cases.title: Define Team Standards
use_cases.description: Ensure team codebases maintain consistent patterns and conventions

prompt_templates.title: Load Project Conventions
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting work on a new project or codebase

prompt_templates.title: Check Convention Compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for convention compliance

prompt_templates.title: Ask Convention Questions
prompt_templates.scenario: Uncertain about naming or style requirements
prompt_templates.prompt: What does our convention say about naming async functions?

prompt_templates.title: Generate with Standards
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating new files following project patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a new service file following our conventions

output_examples.input: What are our naming conventions for constants?
output: Group related constants in a single exported object
Prefix boolean constants with 'is' or 'has' prefix

output_examples.input: How should we organize new feature files?
output: Place feature files in the features directory

best_practices: Load conventions at the start of each coding session
Update conventions.json when project standards evolve
anti_patterns: Writing code without checking conventions first
Ignoring established naming patterns in the codebase
Skipping convention checks during code reviews

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude Code and Claude. Check tool documentation for version compatibility.

faq.question: What convention areas are supported?
faq.answer: Naming, file organization, error handling, testing, and documentation conventions.

faq.question: How do I add conventions to my project?
faq.answer: Create conventions.json in memory/knowledge/codebase/ with your project standards.

faq.question: Is my convention data secure?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only reads local files. No data is transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why are my conventions not loading?
faq.answer: Verify conventions.json exists at the correct path and contains valid JSON.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: Conventions provide guidelines while linters automatically enforce syntax rules.
